docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Caesarean Sections at City Hospitals'' (letters, Feb. 11): My three children were all born at home. In preparation, my midwives educated me much more thoroughly than I would have been had I simply placed my faith in doctors and hospitals. Because of that, I take it with a grain of salt when other mothers, hearing I chose homebirth, tell me ''I would have died'' in a homebirth.
docs.abstract: Ivy Hamlin letter on February 11 letters about Caesarean sections at New York City hospitals
